title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
If you’re looking for a high-growth company where you can make an outsized impact, learn faster than anywhere else, and be part of building the next category leader in AI revenue tech — we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 Upsales is not your typical SaaS company. We’ve spent the last 20 years helping sales teams grow. Now we’re going bigger.
   

  

 We’re pivoting from being “just” a CRM company to becoming Europe’s leading AI platform for B2B revenue acceleration. This is the largest product investment in the company’s history. It touches every part of our business—from strategy and product to sales and data. And our tech team is the driving force.
   

  

 That’s where
 **you** 
 come in.
   

  

 As a Fullstack Developer At Upsales, You’ll Join a Tight-knit Team Of Brilliant Engineers Who Obsess Over Quality And Speed. You’ll
   

  

* Build powerful features end-to-end using React, Node.js, and the latest in AI tech
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and fellow developers
* Work side-by-side with senior colleagues who’ve shipped world-class software
* Take full ownership of your code—from idea to production
* Help shape the architecture as we scale from CRM to AI-powered platform
* Rapidly prototype, test, and iterate—because we move fast, and we love it that way


 Who we're looking for
   

  

 This role isn’t for everyone. We’re looking for a
 **rare kind of builder** 
 :
   

  

* You’ve been working as a Fullstack Developer for at least 5 years
* You’ve worked 3+ years with React and Node.js
* You’re independent, proactive, and love solving complex problems
* You thrive in fast-paced, startup-like environments
* You’re fluent in both Swedish and English
* You bring analytical depth and think critically about code and product
* You care about performance, scalability, and maintainability
* Most importantly: you love tech, you ship fast, and you don’t wait for permission


 We care more about craftsmanship than buzzwords. If you’re the kind of developer who reads the docs before trying a library, who refactors as you go, and who treats every pull request like a chance to learn something—then we'd love to talk.
   

  

 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**👨‍💻 Senior Software Engineer – Web Tech Builder**
 MSAB is on the hunt for a Senior Software Engineer who gets a kick out of building stuff from scratch and geeking out with a crew of skilled coders. Our Unify Core Technology (UCT) team is all about creating the future of web dev at MSAB, and we want someone who loves rolling up their sleeves, simple, fast and maintainable code, and having a blast while doing it. Bonus: you’ll be helping fight crime!
   

  

 🚀 About MSAB
   

  

 We believe that you are dreaming of using your technical skills and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
   

  

 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
   

  

**🎯 What You'll Be Doing**
* Building slick, high-performance web apps from the ground up, with a focus on speed and user happiness.
* Teaming up with a group of passionate nerds who love coding as much as you do.
* Shaping our web tech foundation by crafting tools and systems with serious attention to detail.
* Diving into binary formats, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers to make our systems hum.
* Using Playwright to write rock-solid tests that ensure our apps are bulletproof.


**🧠 What We're Looking For**
* A JavaScript/TypeScript wizard who knows their way around modern web dev.
* Handy with HTML, CSS, and Web APIs, making interfaces that are smooth and snappy.
* A bit obsessed with making things fast, sweating the small stuff that keeps apps zippy.
* Comfortable with binary formats, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers for tackling tricky data challenges.
* Pumped about building from scratch, skipping bloated frameworks, and creating lean, custom solutions.
* Someone who vibes with a team, loves sharing ideas, and enjoys a good code nerd-out.


**🧰 Our Tech Stack**
* HTML/CSS/TypeScript for clean, solid front-end code.
* Next.js SPA (React and React Router) for dynamic, speedy web apps.
* Caddy as our lightweight web server.
* gRPC-web for fast, scalable communication.
* Playwright for writing reliable, end-to-end tests.
* We keep dependencies light, building what we need with care and precision.


**🌍 What We Offer**
 Join a company that's making a real difference. At MSAB, you'll find a collaborative environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to be part of a mission that matters. We are working in a hybrid office model so you can meet your peers as well as working from home.
   

  

 MSAB is a world leader in forensic technology for extracting and analyzing data from mobile devices. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions for a safer world.
   

  

 MSAB deliver high quality digital forensic solutions to extract, review, analyze and manage data and are a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our values encompass being an ethics-driven company focused on innovation and results.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Financial Services
description:
At Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing—making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers—improving their relationships.
 



 To support our growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are looking for a talented Senior Front End Developer to help us get there.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




 You’ll join our Stockholm design team to shape our platform’s interface. You will work together with designers and engineering teams to craft a consistent and accessible component library, implement product features, as well as optimise build and release processes. It’s hands-on and all about creating value and impact.
 



  





**Who You Are** 




 You’re a React pro who writes clean, reusable code, balancing big-picture thinking with fine details. You’ve worked with component libraries or design systems and value consistency. You know when a unit test or visual regression test is needed and thrive in a small, fast-moving team where you own the process from idea to launch.
 



  





**Tech You’ll Work With** 



* Typescript, React and CSS-in-JS for scalable styling
* Testing tools like Jest, Playwright and Storybook
* Analytics to track performance
* Agile workflows with tight team collaboration



  





**Why Work With Us?** 




 At Billogram, we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside, you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges, and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We’re committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You’ll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



  





 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Lead Software Developer
description:
**Position Summary**
 We’re Tacton – a Swedish product company building powerful B2B solutions for manufacturers. Right now, we’re looking for someone to step in as a Lead Software Developer and who thrives at the intersection of delivery, team collaboration, and hands-on tech.
   

  

 This role sits at the core of our product development. You’ll take the lead on a number of parallel initiatives that are critical to our platform. While you won’t be coding full-time, writing code will still be a big part of your day-to-day. You’ll work closely with others to shape and drive technical decisions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
  

  

* Lead a team of developers and collaborate with product managers and designers.
* Write and review code regularly – contributing directly to development while supporting others.
* Drive the development process end-to-end - planning, execution, and iteration.
* Get involved in system architecture decisions and help shape long-term technical direction.
* Clear blockers, keep the team aligned, and make sure deliveries land.
* Be a technical sounding board, helping others grow.
* Join in on hiring and onboarding, and help build a strong, inclusive team culture.


**Skills And Qualifications**
**Required:**
* +7 years' experience in software development
* Has led a team or taken responsibility for delivery and coordination.
* Enjoys collaborating across disciplines — product, UX, and business.
* Can navigate trade-offs, ask good questions, and help others do the same.
* Communicates clearly and constructively, both in code and conversations.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken, with strong communication skills; Swedish is a plus.
* We believe in real-time collaboration and work on-site 3 days a week at our Stockholm office to foster knowledge sharing and innovation.


**Preferred:** 
  

  

* Experience in SaaS product development and cloud technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, AWS).
* Interest in growing into a people management role with direct reports.
* Experience with Java, developing robust and efficient backend solutions.
* Familiarity with test automation and best practices.


**What We Offer**
 At Tacton, we’ve been building CPQ software for over 20 years. We’re a stable company with global customers and a product that’s central to how manufacturers sell.
   

  

 You’ll work with modern tools, alongside people who know the tech and the business. There’s room to grow, take ownership, and contribute to ongoing changes in how we build and deliver software.
   

  

 We offer competitive benefits, flexible ways of working, and a team that shares knowledge.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Technical interview
* Interview with our CPO
* Reference check


**About Tacton**
*Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990’s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help Manufacturers overcome their most business-critical, product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we have grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.*
*We invite you to find out more about us @* 
*www.tacton.com/about*
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Software Engineer (DevOps) - AI Voice Agent Platform
description:
**Join Telavox as Software Engineer- AI Voice 🎙️**
 Are you a DevOps engineer passionate about scalable systems and seamless deployments?
   

  

 We are expanding our AI Voice Agent Platform and looking for a Software Engineer who thrives where development, automation, and AI meet.
   

  

 In this role, placed in Malmö or Stockholm, you'll help us build a reliable foundation for iterating on AI voice products. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers across disciplines to streamline our deployment strategies, automation, and ensure peak performance in production.
   

  

 If you'd like to take your next step within Telavox and are excited by the challenge of enabling AI at scale, this is your opportunity!
   

  

**About The Job**
 You’ll be working on evolving our AI Voice Agent Platform. Your mission is to ensure that our development and deployment pipelines are scalable, reliable, and tuned for the unique needs of voice AI. You’ll work side-by-side with AI engineers and software developers, driving improvements across CI/CD, testing, and observability. Your work will directly impact how quickly and confidently we ship voice AI innovations to customers.
   

  

**Your Day-to-day Work May Include**
* Designing and implementing scalable CI/CD pipelines using tools like GitHub Actions or Jenkins, tailored for AI voice agent development.
* Developing automated testing frameworks unit, integration, and end-to-end to validate AI agent performance and natural language understanding (NLU).
* Collaborating on smart deployment strategies, including canary releases and A/B testing, to roll out AI updates with precision and insight.
* Monitoring and analyzing production performance, proactively identifying optimization opportunities, and ensuring reliability.


**About You**
 You're a technically driven engineer who enjoys building strong foundations for rapid, safe, and scalable development. You’re energized by working closely with other AI specialists and backend developers, and you have a passion for automation, quality, and observability. You thrive on solving complex systems challenges and care deeply about performance, stability, and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Key Skills And Experience We’re Looking For**
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions, Jenkins)
* Strong foundation in observability and production monitoring tools
* Passion for automation and improving development workflows


**Good-to-have Skills**
* Experience with progressive deployment strategies (e.g., canary releases, A/B testing, rollbacks)
* Python proficiency
* Familiarity with AI


****Join us at Telavox 💚****
 Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. As a digital mobile operator, we develop and own our all-in-one communication platform, which integrates telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centers, giving businesses a smarter way to connect.
   

  

 Today, we’re a thriving company with 1.9 billion SEK in revenue and 500+ Telavoxers across nine countries. We embrace AI and automation to push the boundaries of business communication.
   

  

 We offer flexible work options and adaptable hours, giving you the freedom to balance life and career while staying connected to our vibrant Telavox culture.
   

  

**How to apply!**
 At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.
   

  

 We’re always on the lookout for great talent, so applications are reviewed continuously. If you're ready to be part of an innovative, AI-driven telecom company, apply today with your CV and cover letter in English.
   

  

 For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com
   

  

**Learn more about what we do! ⬇️**
 Telavox develops world-leading communications platforms with solutions for smart and efficient telephony, PBX, chat and much more. Regardless of whether it involves an entrepreneur-driven startup or a giant among giants, Telavox contributes to making companies more transparent, efficient and accessible.

title: Backend Developer (Go)

title: Fullstack utvecklare till Vimla / Telenor
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Är du en nyfiken fullstack-utvecklare som vill jobba i en teknikdriven miljö och göra skillnad för hundratusentals aktiva användare? Vimla är mobiloperatören, som genom att vara en fristående del av Telenor, kombinerar kraften från en stor organisation med friheten och flexibiliteten i ett litet team. Vi står för att ta kundfokus, enkelhet och schyssthet till en ny nivå på mobilmarknaden och i vårt team. Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt och roligt att vara kund så väl som medarbetare hos oss!
   

  

 Nu har du chansen att joina teamet i rollen som Senior fullstack utvecklare, ta chansen och sök!
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**
 I rollen som Senior Fullstack utvecklare på Vimla kommer du in i en scale-up miljö där du tillsammans med ditt team arbetar i syfte att utveckla och underhålla Vimlas tekniska miljö. Ni står i centrum för att bygga de tekniska förutsättningarna för en helt digital mobiloperatör. Du arbetar tillsammans med ett tight team av utvecklare med passion för teknik och bra stämning. Teamet består av såväl juniora som mer seniora kollegor, vilket medför en kultur av lärande och kunskapsdelning.
   

  

 Inom ramen för rollen kommer du
   

  

* Bygga och optimera våra API:er
* Förbättra vår CI/CD-pipeline
* Utveckla nya tjänster i vår digitala plattform
* Jobba med skalbarhet i vår molnbaserade miljö


 Hos oss får du möjlighet att utmanas, utveckla din kompetens och arbeta med fantastiska och kompetenta kollegor. Om du gillar att ha en möjlighet att påverka vad du jobbar med, en bredd i dina arbetsuppgifter och jobba i ett tight DevOps-team - det här är platsen för dig!
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Vi ser att du har minst tre års tidigare erfarenheter av utveckling inom Typescript, node backends samt react för frontend. Du har fokus på leverans och säkerställer alltid god kvalitet i slutresultatet och tror att du tidigare har erfarenhet från att designa, bygga och underhålla distribuerade system i en molnbaserad miljö (tex AWS). Vi förutsätter att du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska.
   

  

 Tech-stack du jobbar med:
   

  

* Frontend: React, TypeScript, Redux, Jest, Playwright & React Native
* Backend: Node.js, API-utveckling
* Databas: PostgreSQL
* Arbetssätt: Agilt, DevOps, testdriven utveckling (TDD)


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Svelte
* Nginx, shell-scripting (Bash, Nushell)
* QA-arbete
* DevOps & Infrastruktur: Docker, Kubernetes/Docker Swarm, AWS, CI/CD med GitHub Actions


 På Vimla så värdesätter vi individer som är angelägna om att lära sig och utveckla sin egen kompetens. Vi förväntar oss inte att du känner till alla teknologier i vår stack, så vi letar främst efter någon med ett tillväxttänk och en vilja att lära sig!
   

  

**Varför du vill jobba på Vimla**
 Vimla är på en spännande tillväxtresa och möjligheterna att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss är enorma. Vi är ett roligt, tight team på runt 40 personer i en egen organisation som har stor frihet. Samtidigt är Vimla en del av Telenor Sverige och använder tryggheten som finns i ett stort bolag.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Vimla/Telenor med Experis IT, som har lång erfarenhet av att rekrytera IT-specialister och chefer.
   

  

 Om du har frågor eller vill ha mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulterna Anki Snis på
 **anki.snis@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 70-377 59 69, och Carina Eyoma på
 **carina.eyoma@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 73-086 22 75.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!
   

  

 I enlighet med Telenors policy genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidater i alla rekryteringar.
   

  

 Plats: Stockholm Råsunda

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

 Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!
   

  

 To get a sneak peek into our culture, find us on Instagram: @optimizely
   

  

**Introduction**
 We're seeking a skilled Staff Software Engineer with leadership ambition, to join our Graph team. This role requires significant experience designing, implementing, and maintaining SaaS with high traffic load. This role also requires several years of experience working with TypeScript.
   

  

 You will own epics from initial requirements gathering (PRD) through to successful completion, collaborating with stakeholders to ensure solutions meet market needs. You will implement features by following clean code and SOLID principals. You will also focus on the request latency when implementing features, to make sure our customers applications have good performance.
   

  

**Why is this team critical to Optimizely?**
* Business Impact: Graph is the core content delivery and search service powering the SaaS version of our Content Management System (CMS). Our customers, who rely on Graph for their websites and mobile applications, demand high performance and advanced query capabilities to deliver exceptional user experiences. Graph's reliability and speed directly impact their business success.
* High Visibility & Innovation : Our roadmap prioritizes innovative content delivery and search features, placing search and AI at the forefront of our service offering. This focus differentiates us from competitors and empowers our customers to build cutting-edge web and mobile applications. You'll be instrumental in developing these differentiating features.
* Shape the Future of Digital Experiences: The team plays a critical role in shaping the future of our customers' digital presence. Your contributions will directly influence how they engage their audiences and achieve their business objectives through innovative search and content delivery experiences.


**Some technologies we work with:**
* TypeScript, JavaScript, C#
* GraphQL, REST
* Cloudflare workers, Kubernetes
* Elasticsearch / OpenSearch


**Experience required:**
* 5+ years’ experience of developing and managing services in production
* Several years experience developing with TypeScript
* Expertise with API design and development of GraphQL or RESTful web services
* Partnering closely with internal stakeholders to gain a strong understanding of business and product data needs
* You find satisfaction in being a force multiplier for your colleagues
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or engineering or related experience require


**What sets you apart:**
* Experience developing GraphQL APIs
* Experience managing Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* Experience in Kubernetes, Docker etc. and/ or serverless cloud stacks
* Experience developing multi-tenant services
* Experience working with go-to-market teams
* Understanding the value of pair programming/TDD/Clean Code
* Exposure/Experience leveraging functional languages / paradigms


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Spectator Sports, and Entertainment Providers
description:
**Together with your team, you will have opportunities to shape the architecture and design of our next-generation ball tracking system** 




  





**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?** 




  





**Our mission** 
 is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥
 



  





**At our new office** 
 , you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️
 



  





**We are proud** 
 to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙
 



  





**THE ROLE** 




 Toptracer is currently looking for an experienced Embedded Software Engineer to join our embedded platform team. You will play a crucial role in integrating our ground-breaking tracking software with our camera platform. Together with your team, you will have opportunities to shape the architecture and design of our next-generation ball tracking system, serving thousands of Toptracer golf ranges worldwide.
 



  





**Why you should be intrigued by this role** 




 Be part of building the next-generation ball tracking system for thousands of golf installations globally.
 



 Work on real embedded systems, combining hardware, video, and real-time data processing.
 



 Collaborate with highly experienced hardware, algorithm, and software engineers.
 



 Join a unique company culture that emphasizes teamwork, care, and having fun together.
 



  





**TECH STACK** 




**Embedded Linux** 
 (Yocto-based build system)
 



**Linux Kernel** 
 , BSP development, device drivers
 



**V4L2** 
 (Video for Linux) interface stack
 



**PXE Netboot** 
 and secure OTA update infrastructure
 



**C / C++** 
 , embedded software architecture
 



 Hardware platforms: ARM SoCs, FPGA sensor bridges, MIPI CSI-2 interfaces
 



 (All of the above is not required to apply for the role)
 



  





**POSSIBILITIES** 



* Build, extend and optimize our embedded Linux platform for real-time camera processing.
* Design reliable boot and deployment systems for large-scale field installations (stateless PXE boot, OTA updates).
* Integrate tightly with hardware components: sensors, FPGAs, timestamping subsystems, and high-speed video interfaces.
* Implement low-level drivers, hardware abstraction layers (HAL), and video streaming interfaces (V4L2).
* Collaborate closely with the algorithm team to expose efficient and maintainable interfaces for real-time detection pipelines.
* Participate actively in architectural discussions, code reviews, and continuous platform improvements.
* Contribute to system observability, monitoring, and fleet health management tools.



  





**WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent.
* 5+ years of experience developing embedded Linux systems from board bring-up to production deployment.
* Hands-on expertise with Yocto or equivalent build systems.
* Experience writing Linux kernel drivers and hardware abstraction layers.
* Solid knowledge of embedded system design principles (bootloaders, fail-safe deployment, recovery models, secure boot).
* Strong programming skills in C and C++ for embedded environments.
* Excellent debugging, problem-solving, and system-level thinking.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills, with a pragmatic engineering mindset.



  





**IT`S ALSO GREAT IF YOU** 



* Experience working with FPGA designs and hardware/software co-design.
* Experience with V4L2 (Video for Linux) pipeline design.
* Experience with real-time systems (bare-metal or RTOS environments).
* Experience working with video processing pipelines or high-speed image sensors.



  





**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER** 




  





**Workplace** 




  





 We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
 



  





 In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
 



  





**Culture** 




 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.
 



  





**Activities** 



* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!



  





 The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Integration Developer (Azure Integration Services)
description:
Nu söker vi vår nästa härliga kollega med erfarenhet av att bygga integrationslösningar. Vi är ett gäng utvecklare som jobbar i
 *C#/.NET stacken och drivs av uppdrag med mycket logik och avancerade integrationer. Om du vill bygga unikt anpassade lösningar - då är vi rätt gäng för dig!*
****Vad ingår i jobbet som integrationsutvecklare på Accigo?****
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos oss bygger du nya integrationer med Azure Integration Services & API:er. Självklart har du stor möjlighet att påverka och tycka till om teknikval, det är också något vi både uppmuntrar och uppskattar.
   

  

 Du kommer även att utveckla och underhålla befintliga kundlösningar i förvaltningsåtaganden. Rollen är dynamisk och bjuder på variationsrika och spännande tekniska utmaningar med stora möjligheter att utveckla dina kunskaper och bredda din erfarenhet utifrån dina egna ambitioner.
   

  

 Några exempel på vad du kan komma jobba med:
   

  

* Designa och skapa integrationslösningar i Microsoft Azure
* Designa och skapa API:er och fasader för integrationer
* Möjlighet att jobba med webbutveckling om det lockar
* Samarbeta med kunder och kollegor
* Arbeta självständigt i mindre uppdrag


**Vi söker dig som**
* Under ca 3+ år har jobbat med C# och byggt API:er
* Har kunskap inom Microsoft Azure utifrån att bygga integrationslösningar
* Har erfarenhet inom Azure integration services, tex. Logic Apps, Azure functions, API Management, Azure services bus, data factory och event grid
* Tycker att CI/CD är lika självklart som att solen går upp varje dag
* Är van att jobba i agil scrum-process
* Du är kommunikativ och älskar att ta ansvar från start till slut.


**Det är meriterande om du dessutom har**
* Erfarenhet av att arbetat med BizTalk eller liknande integrationsmotor
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du är en riktig team-player som antagligen gillar att umgås mycket med dina kollegor. För att lyckas på Accigo är det viktigt att du är kommunikativ, nyfiken och prestigelös.
   

  

 Du är en problemlösare som vågar gå utanför din "comfort zone" och testa nya tankar, perspektiv och tekniker.
   

  

 Du gillar att coacha andra och förstår skillnaden mellan att ge kritik och konstruktiv feedback. Sist men inte minst, strävar du alltid efter att göra ditt bästa i alla lägen.
   

  

 Vårt team, här är det högt i taket!
   

  

 Vårt affärsområde som vi internt kallar Cloud & Development är ett team på 19 medarbetare, var av 15 utvecklare och en affärsledare som mer än ofta är ute hos kunderna och projektleder eller kravställer nya spännande lösningar.
   

  

 För oss är laganda och glädje jätteviktigt och vi ser därför till att hitta på roliga aktiviteter med teamet både på och utanför arbetstid.
   

  

 Det ska vara kul att jobba och alla ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas i linje med sin egen ambition. Det innebär att vi arbetar med många utmanande och spännande projekt i ett lagom tempo. Hos oss är det bara din egen ambition och lust som sätter gränsen för hur mycket du kan utvecklas!
   

  

**Nyfiken?** 
 Vi svarar gärna på frågor, eller berättar mer om oss över en kaffe - du kan enkelt komma i kontakt med oss: tyra.drakenberg@accigo.se.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss och träffa våra medarbetare på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Accigo är ett nordiskt konsultbolag som hjälper företag och organisationer med digital affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling med tekniken som möjliggörare. För oss handlar digitalisering till 90% om människor och 10% om teknik. Det är när samspelet mellan människa och teknik fungerar som digitaliseringens fulla styrka visar sig.
   

  

 För många handlar digitalisering mest om teknik. För oss är det så otroligt mycket större. Digitalisering kan få både människor och organisationer att våga sikta högre, följa sina drömmar och öppna dörrar som de inte ens visste fanns. Och när man ser igenom tekniken och börjar skönja vilka möjligheter som gömmer sig där bakom. Då ser man att framtiden kan vara en fantastisk plats – fylld av mänsklig energi och värme – och digitalisering är inget annat än vår superkraft för att komma dit.

title: Lead Developer
description:
*Ungefär 10 % av Sveriges befolkning bor i en HSB-förvaltad lägenhet och nu behöver vi hjälp att utveckla framtidens digitala tjänster. Vill du vara med och forma det framtida HSB* 
 ?
 *Vi söker en Lead Developer som vill vara med och ta oss till nästa teknologiska nivå för att förbättra vardagen för HSBs medarbetare, boende och bostadsrättsföreningar.* 









  





***Vi söker en engagerad Lead Developer***




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Lead Developer är du med bygger upp den teknologiska förmåga HSB behöver för att erbjuda de bästa användarupplevelserna i allt från digitala styrelsemöten till smarta hus och betalningstjänster. Du arbetar tillsammans med utvecklingsteamen i att leverera stabila, säkra och värdeskapande digitala tjänster. Du är teknisk mentor för kollegor och driver tekniska strategier och vägval för våra tjänster och lösningar.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du har arbetat i mer än 10 år som systemutvecklare och vet att de bästa lösningarna uppstår när teknikval och arkitektur grundas i verkliga behov, och du vill bygga system som är både smarta och hållbara över tid.
 



  





 Du hamnar ofta i situationer där du hjälper till att koppla ihop vision med verklighet – och trivs i den rollen. Samtidigt vill du inte släppa kodandet, utan tycker om att vara hands-on och bidra praktiskt till utvecklingen. Du gillar att lösa komplexa problem och har en instinkt för att se vad som fungerar i praktiken.
 



  





 Det här är ingen chefsroll med personalansvar och administration – men du förväntas kunna inspirera andra och vara en mentor. Du delar gärna din kunskap och trivs i en miljö där man löser problem tillsammans. Som person är du nyfiken, social och förtroendeingivande. Du är flytande i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift.
 



  





**Du behärskar** 




 · C#,
 



 · Azure
 



 · DevOps.
 



 · Du har arbetat med molntjänster, mikrotjänstarkitektur, Kubernetes och byggt REST\_API:er
 



  





**HSB Affärsstöd** 




 Vårt uppdrag är att utveckla och förvalta IT-stöd i syfte att skapa nytta och värde för anställda, kunder och medlemmar. Vi ansvarar för utvecklingen av HSBs digitala tjänsteutbud samt drift och förvaltning av gemensamma IT-lösningar. Verksamheten bedrivs agilt enligt SAFe-ramverket och vi har idag ca 50 medarbetare samt ungefär lika många konsulter sysselsatta. Teamet du kommer ha din hemvist i heter Tech & Arkitektur och är ett litet team med spjutspetskompetens inom teknik och arkitektur som stöttar strategiskt viktiga förflyttningar.
 



  





**Vad HSB erbjuder** 




 Placering på vårt nya moderna kontor i Hagastaden, Norra stationsgatan 93, Stockholm med bland annat tillgång till gemensamt gym och cykelgarage med tillhörande omklädningsrum. HSB erbjuder bra villkor och generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
 



  





 HSB strävar hela tiden efter att utvecklas, både som organisation och som arbetsplats, och det vi gör vi när medarbetarna utvecklas. Hos HSB är det du som påverkar din utveckling. Med den rätta ambitionen och stark drivkraft är en anställning inom HSB en bra investering i din karriär. Organisationen präglas av kärnvärderingarna Engagemang, Trygghet, Hållbarhet, Omtanke och Samverkan. Du får också stor frihet under ansvar i arbetet och HSB försöker att hjälpa dig att skapa balans i tillvaron mellan jobb och fritid. Genom att bidra till organisationens framgång kommer dina insatser att värdesättas. Möjligheterna finns hos HSB.
 



  





*Intervjuer kommer att ske löpande, så skicka din ansökan redan nu!* 




*I denna rekrytering samarbetar HSB med Mia Wretborn-Hedberg och Fanni Orestav på Active Search. För att du som kandidat skall få bästa möjliga kandidatupplevelse, ber vi dig ödmjukt att söka tjänsten i ett första steg så kommer ansvarig rekryterare ta kontakt med dig om du har en matchande profil för tjänsten. Alla ansökningar och kontakter behandlas konfidentiellt. Active Search får inte längre ta emot eller hantera ansökningar som inkommer via mejl då detta strider mot direktiven i GDPR.* 




  





*För att din ansökan ska behandlas måste du skicka in din ansökan via Ansök här i annonsen. Om du har frågor eller funderingar om tjänsten, tveka inte att kontakta Mia på telefon: 070 - 727 35 00 eller mia@active-search.se eller Fanni på 073 - 852 79 63 eller fanni@activ* 
 e-search.se

title: Senior Engineer - Svea Solar
description:
Svea Solar is revolutionizing energy management, helping customers optimize their use while on a mission to build a fossil-free future. With 50,000+ customers and over a decade of experience, we deliver smart energy solutions for homes and businesses.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Senior Engineer** 
 to join our team focused on our
 **Energy Optimization** 
**Platform (EOP)** 
 !
   

  

 More about Energy Optimization
   

  

 With a battery and Sunbeam's energy optimization, our customers' electricity usage is automatically shifted to cheaper hours, without them having to think about it. The use of solar and battery power is maximized when electricity prices are high, reducing both their energy bills and carbon footprint!
   

  

 Our EOP team makes this possible, building the software and systems that turn data and distributed energy assets into real, measurable impact. Read more about our EOP solution here.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As a Senior Engineer, you will play a critical role in shaping and developing our backend systems to meet current and future needs. You will not only create applications and configure systems but also drive best practices in software design, architecture, and scalability across the engineering team. You'll report to our Engineering Manager Joe.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Engage in requirements analysis and gathering
* Collaborate with internal teams to develop software designs and architectures
* Write clean and scalable code using C#/.NET
* Establish best practices for testing, deploying, and monitoring applications in production environments
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues, mentor engineers in debugging, refactoring, and optimizing code
* Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle


*We have a collaboration-first policy, which means our employees work three days from the office and two days from anywhere they choose.*
 Are We a Match?
   

  

 To thrive at Svea Solar, it’s important that our values align with yours.
   

  

**We also believe you have:**
* A deep technical understanding and experience as a Backend Developer (preferably with .NET)
* A deep understanding of software architecture and excellent debugging
* Strong skills in communication and collaboration.
* A solid understanding of architecture styles and APIs
* Familiarity with cloud services (we use AWS)


**If you have experience with the following, we are confident that we would be a great match:**
* Exposure to microservices and distributed application architecture.
* Understanding of testing strategies and quality assurance practices.
* A willingness to engage in research and development initiatives involving emerging technologies.


*The requirements may seem extensive, but please feel free to apply if you recognize yourself in some of them.*
 What we offer?
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**
 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include
 **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA** 
 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

 Application?
   

  

* We will begin the process relatively quickly after the advertisement is published.
* On this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.


 We warmly welcome your application! ☀
