**Elekta** 
 is seeking a
 **Commercial Operations Specialist** 
 for supporting Sales, Service, and Order Fulfilment. This role serves as the main interface between the customer and the support functions within the cluster.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 As a
 **Commercial Operations Specialist** 
 , you will ensure that all processes are followed in accordance with Elekta’s procedures and that customers receive consistently high-quality care.
   

  

 This position offers
 **Hybrid working** 
 with flexibility of
 **working from office 3 days a week** 
 .
   

  

**Responsibilities**
***Service Support***
* Administer and assign engineers’ work orders and Axrem documentation
* Manage source and seed orders, exchanges, and logistics
* Process customer spares order, quotes, returns, and commercial shipments
* Distribute and manage TLD badges and calibrated tools
* Administer Field Change Orders (mandatory and non-mandatory)
* Provide feedback to Service Managers and attend daily team meetings
* Maintain engineers’ diaries and support scheduling
* Support PM schedule preparation and customer communication
* Act as Health & Safety and Quality Representative


***Sales Support***
* Serve as main contact for sales and service queries
* Qualify leads and support quote preparation with Customer/Business Managers
* Process sales orders and maintain accurate system data
* Coordinate with logistics, finance, and suppliers
* Manage customer training logistics and reimbursements
* Handle returns and replacements for Brachytherapy and commercial items
* Ensure smooth handover from Sales to Order Fulfilment
* Manage small-value orders/projects and identify process improvements


***Tender & Contract Management Support***
* Coordinate tender submissions and documentation
* Collaborate with sales, legal, and finance to manage contract checklists and risk reviews


**What You Bring**
* Proficiency in Word and Excel (intermediate to expert level)
* Strong organizational and data management skills
* Familiarity with ERP/CLM systems (Salesforce preferred)
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Ability to meet deadlines with minimal supervision
* Experience with Movex is a plus
* Strong attention to detail and team collaboration


***We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement—your unique skills and experiences might be exactly what we're looking for!***
**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.
   

  

 Overview of some of our benefits for
 **Sweden** 
 are as below.
   

  

**United Kingdom**
* 30 vacation days/year, plus an additional 4 Elekta days off/year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Company Car if applicable


**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Nidhi Sarkar, nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com .
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.
   

  

 We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work.

title: Datacenterkonsult
description:
Vill du bidra med din kompetens inom datacenter, server och lagring? Trivs du med att möta nya människor i nya miljöer, samtidigt som du får stora möjligheter att utvecklas i din yrkesroll? Då är du varmt välkommen till oss på Atea. Just nu söker vi en seniorkonsult inom datacenter till vårt kontor i Stockholm som vill hjälpa våra kunder på deras digitala resa.
   

  

**Din roll**
 I rollen som seniorkonsult inom datacenter, server och lagring kommer du få möjlighet att arbeta med en bredd av olika kunder. Rollen kan innebära såväl längre heltidsuppdrag på en specifik kund som att ha flera spännande uppdrag löpande parallellt. Din roll blir central i att hjälpa våra kunder vidare med deras initiativ inom datacentret med fokus på att aktivt arbeta för att rådge dem i deras resa framåt i tätt samarbete med våra säljare och arkitekter.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Arbeta med design, implementation, felsökning, förvaltning och utveckling av våra kunders datacenter-miljöer och IT-infrastruktur
* Delta i projekt och uppdrag som teknisk rådgivare och/eller utförare samt leverera dokumentation efter utsatta krav
* Agera teknisk specialist och rådgivare (såväl internt som mot kund inom ditt/dina kompetensområden)
* Genomföra förstudier, analyser och workshops ute hos våra kunder
* Samarbeta med våra arkitekter vid framtagandet av design
* Supportera vår specialistsäljare vid framtagandet av lösningsförslag
* Löpande utveckla din kompetens genom utbildning/certifiering i nära dialog med våra strategiska partners samt genom att omvärldsbevaka och uppdatera dig gällande vad som händer på marknaden


**Vem är du?**
 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga kompetenser, som är viktiga för att lyckas i rollen och att du ska trivas hos oss. I konsultrollen är du flexibel och trivs med att samarbeta med andra. Du uppskattar möjligheten att möta nya kunder och arbeta i en varierande vardag. Du är självgående och tar ansvar för dina uppgifter, strukturerar och prioriterar ditt arbete och driver dina processer framåt. Du söker aktivt efter nya utmaningar samt utvecklingsmöjligheter hos kunden, både för egen del såväl som för möjligheter för andra konsultkollegor.
   

  

 För tjänsten som seniorkonsult inom datacenter ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Tidigare erfarenhet av konsultrollen
* Mycket god kompetens inom server och virtualisering (VMware, Hyper-V)
* Mycket god erfarenhet av att arbeta med lagring, dataskydd och hyperkonvergerad infrastruktur, gärna från någon av de större leverantörerna så som Dell/EMC, HPE, IBM eller NetApp
* Har en/flera certifieringar från någon av de större tillverkarna Dell/EMC, HPE, IBM eller NetApp
* Svenskt medborgarskap och obehindrad i svenska och engelska språket i tal och skrift
* B-körkort


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Mycket god kompetens inom Dell´s erbjudande inom server och lagring
* Certifieringar inom ovan nämnda produktgrupper från Dell
* Erfarenhet inom Microsoft Azure
* Kompetens inom Ciscos erbjudande inom server (UCS) och hyperkonvergerade (HyperFlex) infrastruktur


**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Med anledning av sommaren och semesterperioden kommer återkoppling på din ansökan eller svar på dina frågor dröja längre än vanligt. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Marcus Albiin, Konsultchef, via marcus.albiin@atea.se.
   

  

 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare. En anställning hos oss kan även innebära placering i säkerhetsklassat uppdrag. Därmed kan en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll komma att genomföras både före och under anställning.
   

  

 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Chief Commercial Officer
description:
*Bjorn Lunden is on an exciting growth journey and is now seeking a business-oriented, strategic, and visionary Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) to join the executive leadership team. In this key leadership role, you will take the lead in shaping Bjorn Lunden’s commercial strategy, driving organizational alignment, and ensuring that Bjorn Lunden consistently delivers exceptional value to customers while supporting the sustainable growth and long-term success of the Group.* 




  





 As CCO, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the Sales and Marketing functions and will take full ownership of Bjorn Lunden’s commercial performance and customer engagement strategy. You will align go-to-market activities with the company’s strategic direction, lead the approach to building long-term customer value, and play a critical role in driving sustainable growth. Additionally, you will be responsible for
 
 Customer Success, making it an integrated part of Bjorn Lunden’s commercial operations – ensuring that customer onboarding, satisfaction, and retention are core pillars of the commercial strategy.
 



  





 As a central member of the executive team, you will have the mandate to shape and develop the commercial organization. This role offers an opportunity for a new CCO to guide the continued development of commercial operations in line with Bjorn Lunden’s growth ambitions. As CCO, you will be responsible for a team of 40 professionals across three countries, including five direct reporting managers. You report directly to Bjorn Lunden’s CEO. The role can be based at Bjorn Lunden’s office in Stockholm or the Hudiksvall Headquarters. The role will involve international travel to various country teams, as well as a regular presence at the Hudiksvall Headquarters.
 



  





**Background and experience** 



* Extensive experience in senior commercial leadership roles, preferably within SaaS or B2B tech companies.
* Deep expertise in Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success leadership.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to build and mentor a team.
* Demonstrated ability to lead transformation and scale organizations in a rapidly growing environment.
* Strong strategic thinking, analytical capabilities, and executional excellence.
* Experience working in close alignment with product and technology functions.
* Experience with international expansion and managing geographically distributed teams.
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English, both written and verbal.
* Previous experience in a Private Equity–backed environment is an advantage.



  





**As a person** 
 you are commercially driven and possess a strong business mindset. You combine a strategic outlook with strong analytical abilities, developing and implementing broad commercial strategies while never losing sight of crucial details. Your natural curiosity leads you to explore new opportunities and adapt readily to change. You lead in an engaging and inclusive way, building trust and collaboration, and encouraging your team’s success.
 



  





**If this sounds like your kind of challenge, apply today by submitting your CV and cover letter!** 




 Due to the summer holidays, the selection process and interviews will be conducted in August. In this recruitment process Bjorn Lunden is collaborating with Novare Executive Search. For more information about the position or the process, please contact Viktor Karlsson, viktor.karlsson@novare.se. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Global Learning and Development Expert
job_function: Human Resources, Administrative, and Customer Service
description:
Are you passionate about driving growth and development in a dynamic, decentralized and global organization?
   

  

 At business area Mining, we’re now looking for a Global Learning and Development Expert – a role where you get the chance to make a significant impact on a global scale!
   

  

**Some Words About Us**
 We’re a global frontrunner in mining and construction industries, enabling the sustainable mine of the future. You’re part of our HR Employee Experience team – a collaborative and inclusive group in the center of our organization, where we value diversity, innovation and excellence. Welcome to our world!
   

  

**About Your Job**
 Here, you play an important role in shaping our organization’s future by designing and implementing cutting-edge learning and development initiatives. To ensure maximum engagement and effectiveness, you leverage a variety of learning methodologies, including instructor-led training, e-learning modules, workshops, simulations, and on-the-job training. Ultimately, in collaboration with our divisions and sales areas, you drive growth, foster talent, and ensure that our workforce is equipped to excel in today’s competitive landscape.
   

  

 You create a supportive learning environment that empowers employees to take ownership of their development journey. As a facilitator, you have the exciting opportunity to create, organize, and conduct business-related training and workshops!
   

  

 Included in your responsibilities:
   

  

* Overseeing the entire lifecycle of learning and development initiatives and needs – including scoping out project requirements, defining milestones, establishing timelines, managing resources, and ensuring deliverables are met.
* Driving successful implementation and adoption of training programs by fostering a culture of collaboration and partnership.
* Implementing robust evaluation methods to measure the effectiveness and impact of learning and development initiatives and continuously refine and enhance the programs.


 You report to the Head of Employee Experience at Mining, and act in close collaboration with the Employee Experience team and our global HR community. The location for this position is flexible between our sites and offices. Since we’re a global business, travel is a natural part of your role, as well as efficient digital collaboration across time zones.
   

  

**Your profile**
 For this role, you need a bachelor's degree in HR, business administration, organizational development or related field. You have proven experience in learning and development roles, with a focus on global initiatives. It’s a plus if you have an understanding and experience of the manufacturing and mining industries. As we act in a global setting, you must be fluent in English, verbally and in writing.
   

  

 When it comes to personality, you have excellent communication, influence, stakeholder management, facilitation, and project management skills. You thrive in a fast-paced, decentralized environment with a global footprint. An innovative mindset and a passion for change and improvement are also key traits in this role. Last but not least, be yourself and stay curious – we like it that way!
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Mariana Rolim, Head of Employee Experience, +46 (0)73-534 9095
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contact in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Cecilia Mickelsson, Unionen, +46 (0)70-616 90 89
* Fredrik Andersson, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-266 78 50
* Olle Hansson, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-650 57 43


 Recruitment Specialist: Therese Rutqvist
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than July 11th, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0080636.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: Sales Executive - Fintech SaaS
description:
**Sales Executive- Net New Business, Fintech Solutions Sales Office of CFO**
**Stockholm based, Hybrid role**
**About Medius**
 Medius is a Swedish origin company & a leading global provider of cloud-based SaaS spend management solutions, helping organizations drive their business forward by enabling best-in-class process efficiency, cost-savings, and greater financial control.
   

  

 Spend management doesn’t ring a bell? This term describes the process from placing an order through its delivery, verification, invoicing to its payment. Our products help companies at every step of the purchasing process, increasing their security and speeding it up. We use the latest advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning to automatically capture and process invoices.
   

  

 If you are seeking a stimulating environment characterized by unparalleled momentum and rapid growth, look no further. Join us as we lead the charge in reshaping the future of spend management, setting new standards of excellence, and driving impactful change across industries.
   

  

 For more info: www.medius.com
   

  

**Our values**
* Connect: We believe in the power of people, both individually and collectively. Our success is driven by respect and understanding, with a shared commitment to empowering finance teams of the future.
* Question: We embrace challenges and value diverse perspectives. By questioning and collaborating, we unlock better solutions and continuously innovate.
* Own: We are proactive, decisive, and committed to delivering results. We anticipate customer needs and follow through, earning their trust to focus on what they do best.


**Corporate Brief….**
 We Are Expanding Our Team And Seeking a Bright, Enthusiastic, Experienced Software Sales Professional With a Hunter Mentality To Help Us Realize Our Goals. If You Have The Following Character Traits, Then This Job Could Be For You
   

  

* You have 2-3 years of multithreaded, B2B Fintech SaaS sales experience to CFO within mid market
* Fluent in Swedish & English, both spoken and written.
* You have the drive, creativity, and experience to make a big impact on our company’s growth
* You are a doer and love the sacrifice/work it takes to win big
* You thrive in an entrepreneurial culture, where you own/drive your region/business


**Opportunity Description**
 Your focus will be the Nordics region. You will be expected to own your territory and build your book of business, while partnering with external business partners, internal and external marketing for lead gen. There won’t be any bureaucracy to hold you back – just your own energy, wits and experience to write your own paycheck.
   

  

**Is This Job for You?**
 We need a great sales person to explore and sell into mid to large enterprises in Retail & Wholesale Distribution, Manufacturing running Microsoft, M3 and SAP ERP in the Nordics region. Our entrepreneurial culture will give you the opportunity to influence our direction and your career while having the stability, benefits and career possibilities of a global company.
   

  

**Some Of The Tasks You Will Perform**
* Generating pipeline
* Present product to prove value and fit for purpose
* Build credible business cases
* Performing web-based and on-site meetings presenting our cloud accounting automation solution to finance, accounting and IT
* Writing pricing proposals and negotiating contracts


**Location**
 Stockholm, Hybrid
   

  

**Enthusiastic?**
 Do you recognize yourself in this role and do you want to learn more about us? Apply today!
   

  

  

  

 Medius links invoice capture, processing, and payment to replace the worry and wondering of managing AP with calm and confidence. Medius goes far beyond basic automation by using artificial intelligence to do most of the work – so invoices get coded, approved and paid; customers get to go home and rest easy; and businesses can trust budgets and forecasts.
   

  

 For more information, please visit medius.com.
   

  

**Our values**
* Connect: We believe in the power of people, both individually and collectively. Our success is driven by respect and understanding, with a shared commitment to empowering finance teams of the future.
* Question: We embrace challenges and value diverse perspectives. By questioning and collaborating, we unlock better solutions and continuously innovate.
* Own: We are proactive, decisive, and committed to delivering results. We anticipate customer needs and follow through, earning their trust to focus on what they do best.

title: Brand Manager Alpro – Scandinavia
company_industry: Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Food and Beverage Manufacturing
description:
**About The Job**
 Do you have a passion for plant-based food and want to drive one of Europe’s most dynamic brands forward? We are looking for a Brand Manager for Alpro in Scandinavia – a strategic and hands-on role with responsibility for developing and executing the brand across Sweden, Denmark, and Norway.
   

  

**Location** 
 Stockholm/Solna
   

  

**Contract** 
 1-year temporary position, starting September 2025
   

  

**Please note** 
 CVs must be submitted in English
   

  

****About The Job****
 As Brand Manager Alpro Scandinavia, you will execute brand development and activation plans across the Scandinavian markets, in line with the Nordic & Baltic strategy and tailored to local market insights. You will monitor category and competitor trends within the plant-based space and ensure that Alpro stays relevant and top-of-mind with our consumers.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities****
* Implement brand and campaign plans in Sweden, Denmark, and Norway
* Develop and optimize the Alpro product portfolio through local and global initiatives
* Collaborate closely with the media, shopper marketing, and sales teams to ensure effective brand communication
* Deliver campaign strategies, creative assets, and brand tools to support in-market activation
* Manage and track the Scandinavian brand budget
* Conduct brand analysis and post-campaign reviews, providing actionable insights and reports
* Ensure internal and external stakeholder alignment throughout all brand activities


 About you
   

  

****About You****
 We’re looking for a passionate and driven marketeer with a strong understanding of the FMCG landscape and the ability to connect strategy with action.
   

  

**Your background**
* Master’s degree in marketing, business, or equivalent
* Minimum 3 years of experience within FMCG
* At least 3 years of experience in marketing or brand management
* We value multilingual skills! If you are proficient in an additional Nordic language like Danish or Norwegian, it's considered a strong advantage.


**Your strengths**
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
* Experience building and presenting brand strategies
* High energy, proactive and results-driven mindset
* Attention to detail and ability to translate insights into action
* Passion for plant-based food and sustainability is a plus


 About us
   

  

 At Danone, our mission is to bring health through food to as many people as possible, and we believe this starts with a healthy planet. Globally, we are over 100,000 employees working across three business categories Dairy & Drinks, Plant-Based Products, and Specialized Nutrition — all committed to our vision of
 **One Planet. One Health.**
 In the Nordics & Baltics, we are 500 employees working with brands like
 **ProViva, Alpro, Yopro, Activia, Actimel, Danonino, Nutricia** 
 , and
 **Aqua d’Or** 
 . We aim to develop healthy food choices for all and grow strong brands in close partnership with our customers and consumers — always one step ahead of trends and tastes.
   

  

 We are proud to be
 **B-Corp certified** 
 , meeting the highest standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability.
   

  

 Learn more at careers.danone.com
   

  

**We Offer**
 A job that could easily turn into a long-term career at Danone. We believe everyone is born with superpowers — something that comes naturally to you. We build careers around these unique strengths to unleash everyone’s full potential. That’s when the magic happens.
   

  

****Our Benefits****
 Danone offers a wide range of benefits across the Nordics & Baltics. While local specifics may vary, we believe in caring for our people
   

  

* Health insurance from day one
* Yearly wellness contribution
* "One share for all" – become a co-owner of Danone
* Flexible and remote work opportunities
* Unlimited access to online learning, training & development programs
* Buddy program and team events
* Free access to our products at the office — enjoy a yoghurt any time!


**To Apply**
 Click the “
 **APPLY** 
 ” button and submit your application
 **in English** 
 by
 **July 30th** 
 . The recruitment process is ongoing, and interviews may be held before the deadline — the position may be filled earlier.
   

  

 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. At Danone, we believe diversity drives success. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace for all individuals — regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.
   

  

**Danone AB** 
 , Gårdsvägen 14, 169 70 Solna, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 #Nordics

title: Mötesbokare B2B | Sales Development Representative
description:
**Vi växer – Vill du vara med på resan?**
 I höst gör vi en extra stor satsning och stärker upp vårt team med fler
 **Sales Development Representatives** 
 . Är du redo att vara en del av ett snabbfotat säljteam där du får arbeta med en unik bredd av kunder från olika branscher? Då kan det vara dig vi söker!
   

  

 Vi letar efter nya talanger till vårt säljteam som arbetar mot några av Sveriges mest välkända företag. Vår största styrka som bolag är variationen i våra kunduppdrag – hos oss får du chansen att bygga nätverk och utvecklas inom flera olika branscher som Bank & Finans, IT, Solenergi och fler.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen som Sales Development Representative?**
 Som SDR hos oss har du en nyckelroll i att identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter och boka kvalificerade möten med beslutsfattare inom B2B. Dina kontaktytor är breda och du riktar dig mot chefer inom bland annat ekonomi, marknad och försäljning.
   

  

 Du arbetar med prospektering, första kontakt och relationsbyggande – och är startpunkten för våra kunders affärsresa.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som drivs av att skapa kontakt, bygga relationer och som vill ta nästa steg inom försäljning. Du är målmedveten, trivs med att arbeta mot tydliga mål och har ett starkt intresse för affärer.
   

  

**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har**
 ✔ Erfarenhet från försäljning, kundkontakt eller mötesbokning (telefon, mail eller digitala kanaler)
   

  

 ✔ Har du arbetat med försäljning inom B2B tidigare är det ett stort plus
   

  

 ✔ Stark kommunikationsförmåga och goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
   

  

 ✔ Ett naturligt driv och viljan att utvecklas inom försäljning
   

  

 ✔ Intresse för olika branscher och förmågan att anpassa din kommunikation efter kund
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 ✅ Fast lön + Provision
   

  

 ✅ Variation – arbeta mot flera spännande kunder och branscher
   

  

 ✅ Utbildningar och coaching för din personliga utveckling
   

  

 ✅ Heltidstjänst: Mån-Fre, 08.00-17.00
   

  

 ✅ Starka team, högt tempo och roliga arbetsdagar
   

  

**Om Impressive Relations**
 Vi är ett växande sälj- och bemanningsföretag som sedan 2012 hjälpt några av Nordens största företag att stärka sina försäljning. Hos oss får du trygghet, utvecklingsmöjligheter och en dynamisk vardag med varierande kunduppdrag. Vi tror på starka team, långsiktiga relationer och möjligheten att växa internt.
   

  

 Vill du bli en del av vår satsning i höst? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi rekryterar löpande!
   

  

**📩 Kontaktperson**
 Felicia Rullander
   

  

 📞 076-425 35 70
   

  

 📧 Felicia.rullander@impressiverelations.se

title: Inside Sales Support and Operations
description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

 The Inside Sales Support and Operations role is accountable for managing and growing the company’s business in existing and new accounts by driving and leading improvements to our business operations in the Nordics. This position offers opportunities to lead strategic initiatives, manage tenders, and support sales execution across the region.
   

  

 This position is part of the Commercial Sales Department and is a remote position based in the Nordics. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**
* Support and coordinate sales activities to achieve and exceed targets across the Nordics.
* Maximize business opportunities and support revenue growth across the product portfolio.
* Lead and manage tender processes and ensure contract compliance.
* Promote menu utilization and expand presence in existing and new accounts.
* Act as a stand-in for vacant territories and coordinate strategic initiatives.
* Collaborate with Marketing and Field Application Specialists to enhance customer experience.
* Manage the sales funnel and CRM data (SFDC) with best-in-class practices.
* Contribute to a highly engaged and performance-driven team culture.


**The essential requirements of the job include:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Science (Biology, Microbiology, Virology preferred).
* Minimum 3 years of experience in diagnostics sales or operations.
* Fluent in English and at least one Nordic language.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Salesforce (SFDC).
* Experience working with a broad range of hospital stakeholders.


**Travel, Motor Vehicle Record & Physical/Environment Requirements:**
* Ability to travel up to 30% within the Nordic region.
* Must have a valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record.


 Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.
   

  

 At Cepheid we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, remote working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement in which you can work remotely from your home. Additional information about this remote work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Cepheid can provide.
   

  

 Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: CGO - Account Sales Executive
company_industry: Computer and Network Security and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**The future is our choice**
 At Atos, as the global leader in secure and decarbonized digital, our purpose is to help design the future of the information space. Together we bring the diversity of our people’s skills and backgrounds to make the right choices with our clients, for our company and for our own futures.
   

  

**Number Of Years Experience**
 Candidate should have a minimum of 15 yrs of experience in IT with a minimum of 8 yrs in the sales.
   

  

**Leadership**
* Acts as a role model for Atos values.
* Incorporating sales management, key account management control skills to build consistently improved business performance
* Handled sales budgets, development forecasts, and business scheduling activities
* Responsible for new business strategies to drive sales success and profitability
* Able to close deal with size of 25-30 M€ TCV
* Experience of Manufaturing / Retail / MedTech industry


**Commercial Drive**
* Recognized as the key client contact point for sales. Used by a client for brainstorming discussions and to create/validate potential innovative propositions and deals.
* Ensures sales activity meets client objectives/needs alongside those of Atos.
* Leads development of qualified new business opportunities and drives through to completion.
* Experience of building a pipeline of 150 M €
* Acts with urgency to resolve customer problems and roadblocks for sales, translating needs into solutions.
* Through extensive knowledge of key client stakeholders, relevant markets and Atos capability steers future activity towards high-value sales.


**Relationship Management**
* Takes responsibility for enhancing relationships at a personal level.
* Operates with presence, conviction, and authority.
* Attains a position of trusted advisor with the client to achieve an effective sales pipeline of work.
* Owns, manages and directly influences deals to a successful closure.
* Manages client (and internal) relations to a sustainable position before and after the deal is completed.


**Planning & Strategy**
* Leads large-scale opportunities, linking multiple Atos service lines to create and shape large-scale value propositions.
* Creates appropriate partnerships from a network of external suppliers to meet client (tender) requirements.
* Owns all planning activities within a defined account, sale (deal) or market.
* Ensures deal qualification activity coordinates with the client buying processes to enable the valuable, efficient sale.
* Owns the deal qualification process for all activity at a local level, driving through compliance and quality contributions from all internal contacts.
* Coordinates sales planning for tier 1 bids.


**Sales Behaviors**
* Demonstrates commitment and urgency in driving through actions.
* Prepares own area of responsibility for the future.
* Creates a forward-thinking culture.
* Leads and encourages knowledge sharing
* Design and implement strategic plans to reach sales targets
* Assess costs, competition, and supply and demand to identify selling prices.


**Education**
* Business Economics & Management
* Having a defense background will be added advantage


**Responsibility**
* Create and maintain excellent relations with customer/s stakeholders on multiple levels.
* Support in developing and implementing the strategy for customers in Sweden/Norway. Can operate at the top management level in the client organization.
* Manages client/sales projects and opportunities with full P&L
* Determine annual unit and gross-profit plans by implementing marketing strategies; analyzing trends and results
* Grow Atos share of wallet at the designated customer/s
* Share of wallet analysis
* Competitor analysis
* Find, shape and close opportunities to increase the share-of-wallet proportion
* Create, maintain and execute sales pipeline for the assigned customer with the size of 50 M€
* Coordinate the global team to close the deal
* Accountable and responsible for initiating and executing required tasks within this area of responsibility
* Analyze pipeline and lead data, deliver periodic reporting to the sales and marketing teams providing key business insights typical reporting relates to Demand Generation, Pipeline Forecast and Trends, Conversion Rates, Target Account, Market Segmentation, Win/Loss, Age
* Participate in the development and implementation of the strategy for either a solution or a specific account. Responsible for steering and executing sales activities and realizes sales targets.


**Sales targets**
* Overall responsibility for achieving financial targets (OE, ER, OM, Cash, WIP & Billing) measured monthly/quarterly/half year and full year
* Able to deliver 20 M€ per year
* Responsible for managing backlog
* Upsell/fertilization
* Scope expansion


**Leads and opportunities**
* By contact with prospective customers at multiple levels, prospects for new sales leads and develops existing sales leads by creating recognition of customers’ business needs and exploring how these can be met by own organization’s products and/or services.
* Leverages sales by creating leads for the complete Atos service portfolio.


**Relationship building**
* Identifies key staff at all management levels in the client organization and build long-term relationships with them.


**Business Development & Bid Participation**
* On request, participate in strategic business development, including potentially creating, developing and maintaining customer relationships for new prospects
* On request, participate in creating strategic plans for clients in business development phase
* On request, participate in bids for existing or new clients


**Negotiation**
* Negotiates with customer representatives, on both technical and commercial issues, to reach mutually acceptable terms for appropriate forms of sales agreements.
* Led high level negotiations to secure various new clients and contracts


**Advise customer on usage**
* Encourages changes in the customer orga­nization’s use of the products and services supplied, to increase the benefits it obtains from them, and to ensure customer reten­tion.


**Planning & budgeting by the customer for Atos services**
* Ensures that the management of the custo­mer organization plans and budgets for new and enhanced products and services.


**Build client & Solution knowledge**
* In case of a specific account focus, builds client knowledge focused on client issues and align Atos solutions/services in a client proposition.
* In case of a specific solution focus, builds solution knowledge in relation to specific markets.


**Market development**
* Develops new ideas for markets and translates them into implications for the organization


**Improve internal efficiency**
* Ensures that the organization continually improves its effectiveness in dealing with customers. Establishes the means of impro­ving service to, and relationships with customers. Monitors the effectiveness of such measures.


 Here at Atos, diversity and inclusion are embedded in our DNA. Read more about our commitment to a fair work environment for all.
   

  

 Atos is a recognized leader in its industry across Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) criteria. Find out more on our CSR commitment.
   

  

**Choose your future. Choose Atos.**

title: 1st Line Support – Bli en del av vårt serviceinriktade team!
description:
Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får hjälpa användare och lösa tekniska problem? Älskar du att hjälpa kunder att lösa problem och få saker gjorda? Isåfall ska du söka vår tjänst 1st Line Support. Rollen är perfekt för dig som brinner för service och har ett stort tekniskt intresse!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Du blir förstahandskontakten för våra kunders superanvändare och hanterar de ärenden de skickar in via vår kundportal, på mejl och/eller på telefon. Hantering, dialog och uppföljning sker i vårt ärendehanteringssystem.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Ta emot och hantera supportärenden via olika kanaler.
* Felsöka och lösa användarproblem relaterade till system, applikationer och nätverk.
* Dokumentera ärenden i vårt ärendehanteringssystem.
* Ge vägledning och support till användare på ett professionellt och serviceinriktat sätt.
* Samarbeta med andra supportnivåer för att säkerställa smidiga lösningar.



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 



* Minst 3–4 års erfarenhet av IT-support, gärna inom 1st Line.
* Kunskap om ärendehanteringssystem och supportverktyg.
* Förmågan att både muntligen och skriftligen, kommunicera tydligt och effektivt, både på svenska och engelska.
* Gymnasieutbildning med IT-inriktning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Ett strukturerat och serviceinriktat arbetssätt.



  





**Meriterande** 



* Certifieringar såsom CompTIA A+ eller ITIL Foundation.
* Erfarenhet av system som Freshdesk, ServiceNow eller Jira Service Desk.
* Bakgrund inom fastighetsförvaltning eller teknisk support i B2B-miljö.



  





**Vad erbjuder vi dig?** 




 I den här rollen får du möjlighet att komma till en arbetsplats med hjälpsamma och engagerade kollegor i en företagskultur som präglas av en stark teamkänsla. Vi befinner oss i en stark tillväxt, och det finns stora möjligheter att utvecklas inom företaget. Vi är en social arbetsplats med många gemensamma aktiviteter, såsom gemensamma frukostar och After Works. Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler på Södermalm i Stockholm och tillämpar hybridarbete. Självklart har vi friskvårdsbidrag, och även möjlighet att träna under arbetstid.
 



  





**Bra** 
 att veta, Detta är en heltidstjänst där du blir anställd av Pythagoras med start så snart som möjligt. Anställningen inleds med en sex månaders provanställning. Bakgrundkontroll kan förekomma.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Du genomför din ansökan via annonsen. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-07-31. Observera
 
 att på grund av sommarledigheter kommer intervjuer att påbörjas i augusti, men ansökningar hanteras löpande under sommaren. För att säkerställa att dina personuppgifter hanteras i enlighet med GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post. Alla ansökningar behandlas konfidentiellt.
 



  





 Vi arbetar utifrån en kompetensbaserad rekryteringsprocess. Det innebär att vi arbetar på ett strukturerat sätt genom hela processen med fokus på de kompetenser som krävs för tjänsten. Detta främjar även mångfalden vilket vi eftersträvar. I processen ingår därför bl.a. urvalsfrågor, tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer.
 



 Har du frågor angående tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Magnus Åstrand,
 
 magnus.astrand@pythagoras.se
 
 och har du frågor gällande processen är du välkommen att kontakta HR Maria Danielsson på
 
 maria.danielsson@pythagoras.se
 
 .
 



  





  





**Om oss** 




 Pythagoras är en ledande leverantör av digitala lösningar för fastighetsförvaltning och verksamhetsstyrning. Vårt innovativa fastighetssystem bygger på digitala tvillingar som visualiserar verkligheten och förenklar teknisk och ekonomisk förvaltning, energiuppföljning och lokalvårdshantering. Med fokus på användarvänlighet, automatisering och datadrivna insikter skapar vi smarta processer anpassade för både privata och offentliga aktörer. Vår långa erfarenhet och kundnära approach gör oss till en pålitlig partner för morgondagens smarta fastigheter.

title: TMS and Transport Process Specialist, Solna - DHL Supply Chain
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
*At DHL, people mean the world to us. We aim to attract and retain the best talents. We provide challenge and opportunity for personal and professional development. We make sure that you know what a difference you make to our business and how you can be proud of building THE logistics company for the world.*
 Under the DHL Supply Chain umbrella, one of the business units of DHL, our mission is to provide customized logistics and industry solutions in the areas of supply chain management, warehousing, distribution, value added services, and lead logistics provider services for our customers - helping them deliver better results every day.
   

  

**Ready to drive the future of transport solutions in the Nordics?**
 DHL Supply Chain Nordics is now looking for a TMS and Transport Process Specialist to lead the development and rollout of the transport management system (TMS) in the Transport Control Tower. In your role, you will be part of the Nordics Transport Team, reporting to the Nordics Transport Lead. The position is full time and based at our head office in Solna, with the possibility of hybrid work.
   

  

**Your main tasks include:**
* Lead implementation of our TMS and transport processes in the Nordics region (Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark).
* Ensure system and process standardization across the region.
* Drive automation of transport tasks through EDIs, APIs, RPAs, etc.
* Design and implement standard automated solutions for Order Entry, Master data maintenance, Transport Booking, Track & Trace, KPI reporting, Freight Bill Audit and Customer invoicing.
* Deliver maximum benefit of TMS from planning and route and vehicle optimization.
* Setup and drive a program to integrate carrier systems with our TMS.
* Deliver high-quality training sessions and sales demos of our TMS.
* Manage customer onboarding projects.


**We expect you to have:**
* A minimum of 2 years project management experience (stakeholders, scope, timeline, solution design, etc.)
* Ability to engage and manage multiple stakeholders in complex projects.
* Experience of working in the Transport Industry or similar.
* Preferred knowledge of Oracle TMS and Transport operations.
* Experience of working with (MS Access, MS Excel, Oracle, Java, .Net).
* Good knowledge of databases, SQL, Power BI and master data management.
* Fluent both speaking and writing in Swedish and English.


**It is meritorious if you have:**
* Knowledge in Finnish.


**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**
* Responsible.
* Problem-Solving.
* Analytical.
* Communicative.


 At DHL Supply Chain we offer a culture that values our people as our most important asset, ensuring they feel safe, valued, and empowered to grow. We have a commitment to operational excellence, delivering reliability, agility, and exceptional value to our customers.
   

  

**Ready to hop on the role? Join us now!**
 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. Please send your application including CV in English no later than
 **07.07.2025.** 
 Nordics Transport Lead Thomas Björklund will answer your questions regarding the role: Thomas.bjorklund@dhl.com

title: Financial Controller Nordic
description:
**About Ingram Micro**
 Ingram Micro is a leading technology company for the global information technology ecosystem. With the ability to reach nearly 90% of the global population, we play a vital role in the worldwide IT sales channel, bringing products and services from technology manufacturers and cloud providers to business-to-business technology experts. Our market reach, diverse solutions and services portfolio, and digital platform Ingram Micro Xvantage™ set us apart. Learn more at www.ingrammicro.com.
   

  

 SCOPE & PURPOSE:
   

  

* Newly created role, offering the opportunity to shape the future direction of the Finance team, and broader organisation.
* Own all aspects of enhancing and ensuring compliance with a robust financial control environment
* Oversee the timely reporting of accurate and complete financial results.
* Working hand in hand with the F, P&A team to develop insights for decision making and process improvement


 PRINCIPAL TASKS OF JOB / CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:
   

  

* Oversee the timely reporting of accurate and complete financial results consistent with Ingram Micro accounting policies and in compliance with US GAAP requirements for 4 legal entities (Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway).
* Take ownership of the overall financial control environment, including the relationship with General Ledger activities undertaken by our offshored shared service centre.
* Act as End-to-end process owner for processes impacting our financials, including the design of, and ongoing application of relevant controls.
* Consulting with corporate controllership on technical US GAAP matters.
* Oversee accurate and timely tax submissions (detailed VAT and CIT work undertaken by relevant SME’s).
* Oversee the Group and local Statutory Audits (4 legal entities), including owning the relationship with external auditors.
* Acting as senior member of the Finance leadership team, work with F,P&A team to develop a suite of reporting that facilitates meaningful business insights and enhanced decision making.
* Autonomously respond to ad-hoc queries from Regional and Global finance functions.


 PRIMARY COMPETENCIES:
   

  

 Innovation
   

  

* Proficient in identifying problems, analysing them and finding effective solutions.
* Leading initiatives and influencing others to embrace and participate.


 Judgement and Decision Making
   

  

* Capable of independent thinking and able to work proactively and autonomously.
* Strategic thinker.
* Offer own conclusions and recommend actions based on findings.
* Well-developed analytical skills: proven ability to set up and critically evaluate reporting and relevant KPI’s


 Communication and Collaboration
   

  

* Good communication and presentation skills. Able to simplify complex arguments in both verbal and written communication.


 Influence and relationship building
   

  

* Ability to work cross-functionally, building strong relationships while challenging the status quo.
* Influence change and enhancements to current working practices to improve efficiency.


 Planning and Organising
   

  

* Able to review current workload and prioritise accordingly, ensuring that deadlines are met.
* Works to ensure tasks and activities are completed efficiently and effectively for stakeholders.


 Accountability
   

  

* Must be results oriented and take full ownership of identified issues.


 You would need to have experience from:
   

  

* "The Big 4" qualified
* Good understanding of US GAAP
* Good understanding of Nordic local accounting and tax regulations
* Over five years’ experience in Senior Finance control position
* ERP implementation
* Auktoriserad revisor or Godkänd revisor


 You would need to fluency in English. Fluency in Swedish and any other Nordic language is meriting.

title: Sourcing Manager
description:
DeLaval is now looking for a Sourcing Manager within Category Electrical & Motion Control . We are looking for you who have high ambitions and have the guts to make challenging decisions. If you enjoy communicating and negotiate this might be your dream job!
   

  

 DeLaval Sourcing is a team of 60 sourcing professionals located in Europe, Americas and China. Here you get the opportunity to work internationally.
   

  

 You will play a key role in creating long term sourcing strategies within Category Electronics, to define and execute plans to meet the objective of developing the optimal supplier base for DeLaval – today and in future.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Create and implement strategies for the sub-categories with Electronics.
* Overall responsible for the assigned suppliers.
* Contract management (create, maintain, terminate).
* Deliver on KPI’s like cost savings, contract coverage, payment terms, Quality, Sustainability; overall supplier performance in accordance with our Supplier Score Card.
* Define strategic sourcing opportunities and work with Product owners, Engineering, Factories and Logistics to execute.


**Qualifications And Experience**
 You are a person with great commercial interest and a passion for doing business while staying close to the technology. You are analytical, structured, take own initiatives and with ability to handle multiple things at the same time.
   

  

 You are good at maintaining relationships and like to represent sourcing in cross functional teams as well as towards suppliers in a professional way. You are also self-driven with high integrity and contribute to the development of the team. Within all these areas of competence you have previous experience within strategic sourcing in an international environment.
   

  

 We expect you to have an academic degree or equivalent.
   

  

 As the role involves communication with global suppliers, you are fluent in English, and preferably also in Swedish.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 O ur core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. Travelling will be part of the position. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**For Further Information, Please Contact**
 Stefan Linde Category Director, hiring manager: stefan.linde@delaval.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Director Analyst, AI Data & Analytics for Leadership Expertise (Remote Europe)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
Analyst will create Gartner research and provide related advice to clients and support the sales force in new sales and client retention. The research provides insight, predictions and actionable advice to clients in the area of AI, GenAI, Machine Learning (ML) and Data Science. This includes writing about, presenting and advising organizations about AI technologies, governance, best practices, market trends and vendors and their solutions, service providers, governance and best practices in AI.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Conduct research and analysis in AI, GenAI, Machine Learning and Data Science. Specific areas of focus will include strategy, best practices, market trends, technologies and vendors.
* Applicable experience in an industry discipline and deep knowledge of a particular market, industry or role; understanding of both technology and industry to include the market, products and user strategies in specific areas.
* Cover the specified areas as well as applicable adjacent areas, while maintaining a view across a broad spectrum of the market, to produce innovative, thought-leading, impactful, fact-based research.
* Identify critical questions facing Gartner clients and crafting appropriate research methods to address them. Provide in-depth analysis based on extensive client input, collaboration with other Gartner analysts and personal experience.
* Lead a body of research and be recognized in the industry as a subject matter expert – develop a following.
* Create and deliver high value presentations and other materials.
* Assist the Sales organization in selling and retention on topics covered by the Analyst's team.
* Provide high quality and timely research peer review. Provide mentorship and support team members.
* Actively participate in or lead research projects as needed and collaborate effectively with peers.


**Who you are:**
* Articulate and succinct communication skills; ability to explain complex ideas effectively.
* The ability to communicate credibly and effectively with executive audiences (executive presence) and presentation skills.
* Exceptional analytical skills: ability to apply conceptual models, recognize patterns and draw and defend conclusions. Ability to think abstractly and strategically is a must.
* Strong project planning and management skills.
* Ability to take direction and be self-directed in executing against plans.
* Strong collaboration ethos, influencing and leadership skills.
* A motivated, creative individual who can grow research depth and skills.


**What you will need:**
* 10+ years of experience within the technology field, specifically AI/ML.
* relevant qualifications and/or relevant experience preferred
* Technology and business knowledge of end user strategies, AI/ML market, vendors and products.
* AI/ML model development, deployment and management.
* Application development and use implications of AI
* AI Governance
* AI vendors comparisons including cloud based AI services (ex. Amazon, Google, Microsoft)
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience; Graduate degree preferred
* Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:101413
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Assistant Professor in immunology
description:
**Join a global community of excellence**
 Are you a bold, creative researcher ready to shape the future of medical science? Karolinska Institutet (KI), one of the world’s foremost medical universities, is launching a major recruitment initiative in 2025. KI is seeking
 **20 outstanding early- career researchers** 
 to join us as Assistant Professors in a wide range of subject areas.
   

  

 At KI, we foster a vibrant, international research environment where curiosity, innovation, and excellence thrive. We are looking for inspiring, driven, and visionary scientists with exceptional research achievements and the potential to become future leaders in their fields.
   

  

 The Department of Clinical Sciences at Danderyd Hospital is dedicated to high-impact clinical and translational research across a wide range of medical disciplines. Embedded within Danderyd Hospital (KIDS) - hosting approximately 400 medical students annually and over 46,000 inpatient admissions and 430,000 outpatient visits—the department is uniquely positioned for close integration between research and patient care. Our clinical environment comprising clinical biobanking and specialized platforms such as a human adult stem cell (hASC) organoid facility ensures direct access to patient samples, supports a true bench-to-bedside-and-back research model and accelerates the development of patient-centered innovations.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 If you meet our requirements and propose a groundbreaking research project, we are prepared to employ you as an Assistant Professor for six years and support you with a generous funding package of SEK
 *[9 or 12]* 
 million to cover your salary and other research costs. KI offers the opportunity to be promoted from a time-limited (six-year) position as Assistant Professor to permanent employment as Senior Lecturer. You can read more about it here.
   

  

 At KI, you’ll be part of an interdisciplinary research community. Our researchers work across a wide range of fields and methodologies within medicine and health, creating rich opportunities for knowledge exchange and cross-disciplinary collaboration. You’ll also benefit from close connections with healthcare providers, ensuring your research remains closely aligned with real-world clinical practice.
   

  

 As a state university, KI offers a comprehensive benefits package governed by collective agreements. These include annual salary reviews, supplementary insurance, and opportunities to participate in institutional decision-making.
   

  

 We also understand that a successful research career is supported by a strong personal foundation. That’s why we are committed to supporting not only our researchers but also their partners and families, recognising the vital role they play in your life and well-being.
   

  

 Learn more about what KI and Sweden can offer, and the different calls!
   

  

**Location:** 
 Danderyd
   

  

**Description Of The Subject Area**
 We are seeking a skilled and ambitious junior researcher with a passion for discovery and translational immunology to join our dynamic academic environment. This position is based within the mucosal immunology group and is part of an ERC-funded research program aimed at exploring the structure-function relationships of mucosal IgA, with the goal of guiding next-generation vaccine and therapeutic antibody design. Leveraging our globally unique biobank of human nasal secretions, the project explores recombinant secretory IgA candidates using affinity LC-MS, cell-based assays, omics approaches, and hASC-derived nasal and lung organoids. This is a unique opportunity for a motivated early-career scientist to contribute to cutting-edge research while actively shaping the development of a growing lab.
   

  

**Your mission**
 This Assistant Professor position offers a unique opportunity to build a strong academic profile—primarily by developing your independence as a researcher, while also gaining valuable teaching and pedagogical experience.
   

  

 As Assistant Professor, you will play a central role in advancing the mucosal immunology group’s core research goals in translational immunology. In the initial years, your work will closely support the principal investigator across experimental planning, data interpretation, grant writing, and mentorship of junior researchers, while independently driving select subprojects. The position provides a structured path toward research independence. The successful candidate is expected to gradually establish their own research profile and, within 3–6 years, begin building an independent research group. You will have the opportunity to define your scientific niche, launch new research directions, and contribute to the long-term strategic and scientific vision of the lab.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirements**
 To be eligible for an appointment as Assistant Professor, you must demonstrate good scientific skills according to KI’s eligibility criteria as follows:
   

  

* A PhD (or equivalent degree) in a relevant subject area
* At least two peer-reviewed original scientific publications as first or last author, in addition to the doctoral thesis


 Priority is given to those who were awarded a PhD (or attained equivalent competence) no more than seven years prior to the expiry of the deadline for the application.
   

  

 Those who have been awarded a doctoral degree or attained equivalent research competence earlier will also be considered if there are special circumstances for absence from research (deductible time), such as: parental leave, long-term illness, positions of trust in trade union organizations or mandatory service in total defence.
   

  

 The circumstances, dates and extent must be clearly specified in the application and verified by relevant documentation.
   

  

 For this call, exceptions are made from all pedagogical requirements specified in the instructions regarding the Appointment procedure for teachers at KI. However, you must complete three weeks of higher education pedagogical courses in accordance with the Association of Swedish Higher Education Institutions’ recommendations, no later than two years after starting your employment as an Assistant Professor (unless you can certify that you have completed equivalent training before starting the position).
   

  

**Assessment criteria**
 Candidates will be evaluated based on both scientific and pedagogical qualifications, with greater emphasis placed on scientific excellence. The full set of assessment criteria is outlined in the instructions regarding the Appointment Procedure for Teachers at KI.
   

  

**Particularly meritorious is:**
* the scientific quality, originality, and feasibility of your research plan within the relevant subject area
* documented experience in research environments outside KI, with special consideration given to international research experience


 These criteria reflect our commitment to fostering globally competitive researchers who contribute to high-impact science and academic excellence.
   

  

**It is further meritorious that you have demonstrated**
* You are a researcher with a PhD in life sciences
* A strong background in mucosal immunology
* A strong interest and experience in antibody glycosylation
* A strong interest and experience in organoid culturing
* A strong interest in and experience of supervising PhD students
* Excellent organizational, planning and record-keeping skills
* An open and service-minded attitude
* Excellent teamwork and communication skills
* Excellent English skills, written and spoken


 The criteria listed will form part of the overall assessment of the applicant. All criteria will be assessed but they should not individually be seen as requirements.
   

  

 Offers will be extended to the best candidate based on an overall assessment of the applicant’s expertise and merits in relation to the subject area.
   

  

**Application guidelines**
 All applicants are expected to follow the application instructions carefully. Failure to comply with the guidelines or misrepresentation of qualifications may negatively impact on the evaluation of your application.
   

  

 The application should consist of the following documents, written in English:
   

  

* A personal letter (maximum 1 page)
* Application form, including your research project (the form can be found here)
* Up to ten published papers and optionally one manuscript, in PDF format
* PhD certificate
* If you have a PhD that is older than seven years and want to claim deductible time, you must attach a certificate of deductible time in Swedish or English.


 Welcome to apply no later than
 **September 2nd, 2025 (time 23.59 CEST)** 
 .
   

  

 For more information about the calls, conditions regarding funding and employment, see
 ***here***
 .
